unicode.value:
CONTEXTUALIZACIÓN 

Esta secuencia didáctica está dirigida a alumnos de 4º de ESO donde trabajarán la vida y obra del escrito americano Edgar Allan Poe en la asignatura de inglés. 

TEMPORALIZACIÓN 

1 sesión de 55 minutos.

COMPETENCIAS CLAVE

-Competencia Ciudadana

-Competencia Digital 

-Competencia en Comunicación Lingüística

-Competencia en Conciencia y Expresión Culturales

-Competencia Plurilingüe

-Competencia Personal, Social y de Aprender a Aprender

OBJETIVOS 

-Aprender sobre la vida y obra de Edgar Allan Poe.

-Entender información de forma oral mediante un vídeo.

-Entender información de forma escrita mediante textos escritos ordenando sus fragmentos.

-Expresar ideas e información de forma oral respondiendo a preguntas de forma oral. 

SABERES BÁSICOS 

A. Communication

− Basic strategies for planning, executing, controlling and repairing the comprehension, production and co-production of oral, written and multimodal texts, such as complete sentences, units of oral interaction, and a repertoire of everyday links, connectors, and conjunctions.

− Contextual models and basic discursive genres in the comprehension, production and co-production of oral, written and multimodal, short and simple, literary and non-literary texts: characteristics and recognition of the context (participants and situation), expectations generated by the context; organization and structuring according to genre and textual function.

− Basic sound, accentual, rhythmic, and intonation patterns and general communicative meanings and intentions associated with these patterns. Intonation of compound sentences, strengthening the pronunciation of sounds of the foreign language.

− Learning resources and basic information-seeking strategies: dictionaries, reference books, libraries, digital and computer resources, etc. Guided selection of reliable digital tools.

− Basic analogue and digital tools for oral, written and multimodal comprehension, production and co-production; and virtual platforms for interaction, cooperation and educational collaboration (virtual classrooms, videoconferences, collaborative digital tools, etc.) for learning, communication and the development of projects with speakers or students of the foreign language.

B. Multilingualism

− Strategies and techniques to respond effectively to a basic and concrete communicative need in an understandable way, despite the limitations derived from the level of competence in the foreign language and in the other languages of the own linguistic repertoire.

− Basic strategies for identifying, organizing, retaining, retrieving and creatively using linguistic units (lexicon, morphosyntax, sound patterns, etc.) based on the comparison of the languages and varieties that make up the personal linguistic repertoire. Tools for inferring meaning in sentences from known words. 

− Basic strategies and tools.

C. Interculturality

− The foreign language as a means of interpersonal and international communication, as a source of information and as a tool for personal enrichment. 

− Interest and initiative in carrying out communicative exchanges through different media forms with speakers or students of the foreign language. 

− Basic socio-cultural and sociolinguistic aspects relating to daily life, living conditions and interpersonal relationships; basic social conventions; nonverbal language, linguistic courtesy, and digital etiquette; culture, customs and values of countries where the foreign language is spoken. 

− Basic strategies for understanding and appreciating linguistic, cultural and artistic diversity, taking into account eco-social and democratic values.

METODOLOGÍA 

Se usará una metodología activa donde se trabajarán diversas habilidades como Reading, Listening o Speaking. A su vez, diferentes fuentes de información, tipología de ejercicios y actividades se llevarán a cabo siguiendo el DUA. Algunas actividades se realizarán de forma individual o otras se harán de forma grupal llevando a cabo un trabajo colaborativo y grupal. 

CRITERIOS DE EVALUACIÓN 

1.1. Interpret and analyse the overall meaning and specific information of short and simple oral and multimodal texts on frequent and everyday topics, of personal relevance and close to the students' experience, typical of the fields of interpersonal relationships, learning, the media, expressed clearly and in the standard language through various supports.

1.2. Interpret and analyse the overall meaning and specific information of short and simple written texts on frequent and everyday topics, of personal relevance and close to their experience, typical of the fields of interpersonal relationships, learning, the media and fiction, expressed clearly and in the standard language through various supports.

1.3. Select, organize and apply in a guided way the most appropriate strategies and knowledge in everyday communicative situations to understand the general meaning, essential information and most relevant details of texts; interpret nonverbal elements; and search for and select information.2.1. Verbally express short, simple, structured, comprehensible and appropriate texts on everyday and frequent matters, of relevance to students, in order to describe, narrate and report on specific topics, in different formats, using verbal and non-verbal resources in a guided way, as well as strategies for planning and control of production.

2.1. Verbally express short, simple, structured, comprehensible and appropriate texts on everyday and frequent matters, of relevance to students, in order to describe, narrate and report on specific topics, in different formats, using verbal and non-verbal resources in a guided way, as well as strategies for planning and control of production.

2.3. Select, organise and apply knowledge and strategies in a guided manner to plan, produce and revise texts that are comprehensible, coherent and appropriate to the communicative intentions, contextual characteristics and textual typology, using the help of the most appropriate physical or digital resources according to the task and needs of each moment, taking into account the people to whom the text is addressed.

5.2. Use different knowledge and strategies to improve the ability to communicate and learn the foreign language, with the support of other participants and analogue and digital media sources.

6.1. Act empathetically and respectfully in intercultural situations, building links between different languages and cultures and rejecting any type of discrimination, prejudice and stereotype in everyday communicative contexts.

6.3. Apply, in a guided manner, strategies to explain and appreciate linguistic, cultural and artistic diversity, taking into account eco-social and democratic values and respecting the principles of justice, equity and equality.
What do you know about this famous American writer and poet?

Watch de following video and answer the questions. 

Edpuzzle. Edgar Allan Poe. (CC BY-SA 4.0)

Now, reorder the following fragments in order to create the correct text. 

  • From the time I was a child, I loved animals very much. I had many pets, and I felt happy when I fed and cared for them. When I grew up, I married a woman who also liked animals. Together we had birds, a dog, a rabbit, a monkey, and a big black cat called Pluto. Pluto was my favourite pet. He followed me everywhere, and I loved him. But things started to change. I began to drink too much alcohol, and little by little I became angry, rude, and violent. I shouted at my wife and hurt my other animals. Only Pluto was safe, because I still had some affection for him. One night, when I was drunk, Pluto tried to avoid me. I grabbed him, and he bit my hand. Full of anger, I cut out one of his eyes. In the morning I felt guilty, but soon I forgot everything in more alcohol.
  • Pluto recovered, but now he was afraid of me and ran away when I came close. At first I felt sad, but soon I became angry. One day, because of a strange feeling of perverseness, I put a rope around his neck and hung him from a tree. I cried, but I still killed him. That same night, a fire started in my house. My wife and I escaped, but everything was destroyed. The next day, I went to see the ruins. On the only wall still standing, there was an image of a giant cat with a rope around its neck. At first I was terrified, but then I told myself that someone had thrown the cat into my room during the fire, and the body made this strange mark on the wall. Even so, for months I could not forget the horrible picture of the cat on the wall.
  • One night, in a bar, I saw another black cat. It looked almost the same as Pluto, except for a white spot on its chest. The cat followed me home, and my wife loved it. At first I liked the cat, but later I began to hate it. It always followed me, jumped on my knees, and rubbed against me. I wanted to hurt it, but I remembered Pluto and felt afraid. Later, I noticed the white spot on its chest began to look like a gallows, the place where people are hanged. This filled me with terror. The cat never left me alone. At night I had nightmares, and during the day it stayed close to me. I started to hate everything and everyone. My wife suffered because of my violent temper, but she stayed silent and patient.
  • One day, I went to the cellar with my wife, and the cat followed us. It almost made me fall on the stairs, and I became furious. I took an axe to kill it, but my wife stopped me. I turned and killed her with the axe. She fell dead immediately. I decided to hide the body. Finally, I put her inside the wall of the cellar and covered it carefully with bricks. Nobody could see anything strange. The cat disappeared, and I was happy. Four days later, the police came to search the house. I was calm because I thought everything was perfect. When they were ready to leave, I hit the wall proudly with my cane. Suddenly, a terrible cry came from inside. The police broke the wall and found my wife’s body. On her head was the black cat, alive, with its red mouth and burning eye. I had walled it up with the corpse.

Try

Correct!

It's not correct... The correct answer is...
Provide instruction on how the True/False Question should be completed.
Comment on this sentences whether they are True or False.
Enter any feedback you wish to provide to the learner. This field may be left blank. if this field is left blank default feedback will be provided.
A hint may be provided to assist the learner in answering the question.

True/false questions present a statement where the learner must decide if the statement is true. This type of question works well for factual information and information that lends itself to either/or responses.
Type the question stem. The question should be clear and unambiguous. Avoid negative premises as these can tend to be ambiguous.
Escriba la pregunta. La pregunta debe ser clara y no ambigua. Evite las premisas negativas ya que esta tienden a ser ambiguas.

Introduzca la retroalimentación que quiere que vean los estudiantes después de haber intentado completar la actividad. Este campo se puede dejar vacío. Si este campo está vacío se ofrecerá la retroalimentación por defecto.
Se puede proporcionar una pista para ayudar al estudiante a responder la pregunta.
Escriba la pregunta. La pregunta debe ser clara y no ambigua. Evite las premisas negativas ya que esta tienden a ser ambiguas.
After the noise, the protagonist went to the kitchen and discovered the grotesque scene.

Introduzca la retroalimentación que quiere que vean los estudiantes después de haber intentado completar la actividad. Este campo se puede dejar vacío. Si este campo está vacío se ofrecerá la retroalimentación por defecto.
Se puede proporcionar una pista para ayudar al estudiante a responder la pregunta.

Now it's your turn to create an infographic in groups and each group will be in charge of one aspect/section of the infographic. Here are the steps:

1. Groups of 5 people (chosen by the teacher heterogeneously)

2. Assign roles among the groups.

-1 group will be in charge of Poe's life.

-1 group will be in charge of Poe's historial period. 

-1 group will be in charge of Poe's literature period.

-1 group will be in charge of Poe's works.

-1 group will be in charge of Poe's repercussions nowadays in present literature and his influence. 

3. Use Canva to create an infographic about your chosen work. It will be a collaborative work that you have to complete on one single template. 

Here you can find a perfect model to follow:
